A mix of Hard Rock, Rock'n'Roll and Heavy Metal combining Metallica energy, MotÃƒÂ¶rhead tipsy bad manners and some gloomy Black Sabbath-inspired passages: the result is Ã¢â‚¬Å“250 DollarsÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½, the debut album by Verona-based rockers Dirty Fingers.

 As wild as a fierce animal and as fast as a reckless run on a highway, the album hits the ground running in an emotional surge, a sick heart pounding feelings, an alcohol-soaked sponge squeezed in a raging fist.

 The perfect sound for an old smoky saloon with cheap strippers, where you can easily imagine Dirty Fingers sitting in a dark corner, holding their instruments and smoking cigarettes, ready to spit out their rough hard Rock'n'Roll while a shameless waitress serves them some more beersÃ¢â‚¬Â¦ "250 Dollars" was recorded at Atomic Stuff Studio (Isorella, Brescia, Italy) by Oscar Burato.
